tweets.text:
#DYK that rainfall can wash dog poo into bathing waters through the surface water drains and streams, even if the dog fouls far from the beach? 

Make sure that you bag up your poo and put it in the bin.

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/fLYfl9gfch

We need to make space for üíßwaterüíß. Our Living Floodplains projects will restore these vital wetlands to act as a natural sponge. 

Find out more about our Living Floodplains project: https://t.co/woeiKHq7hJ 

#LetNaturehelp #floods #RiverTrent @EnvAgencyMids @HighwaysEngland https://t.co/FsHaL0Qz0D
The fish pass at Lower Mill on the Letcombe Brook is now completed and flowing well! Nice working with you @CainBio and thanks for the funding @EnvAgency https://t.co/DAmorl9lKq
@AlanMembury @RuralCrimeTeam @EnvAgencySW @AnglingTrust @ATFreshwater @EnvAgency It‚Äôs not an accidental omission and as such one has to ask why th  as t would be.

tweets.text: PCSO Balchin has been out patrolling fish poaching hotspots on the River Frome today. We need people to report poaching, hare coursing and illegal fishing to us at the time it‚Äôs happening by calling 999 immediately. Recent incidents, that are not happening at the time Call 101. https://t.co/KexgvvnmAv

@ashsmith43 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV Upstream of Fairford there are problems too - reed growth is out of control with vegetation now blocking Coln. Bottom is muddy, water is brown. Used to be able to see golden gravel on bed.

@ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV According to last year's data, in 2019 @thameswater spent 2,207 hours, the equivalent of 92 whole days, dumping sewage into the River Coln from the Fairford sewage plant.
